tools.name: honeycomb_list_slos
tools.description: Lists all Service Level Objectives (SLOs) defined in a Honeycomb dataset. Use this to discover existing SLOs, review service reliability targets, or before creating related burn alerts. Requires the dataset slug parameter. Returns a list of SLO objects with their IDs, names, target percentages, time periods, and SLI (Service Level Indicator) definitions.

dataset.description: The dataset slug to list SLOs from

confidence.description: Claude's confidence level in this tool call. 'high' = certain this matches user intent and will succeed, 'medium' = likely correct but some uncertainty, 'low' = uncertain but best available option, 'none' = guessing or placeholder value.

notes.description: Structured reasoning notes explaining Claude's decision-making process. All categories are optional arrays of single-sentence strings.

decisions.description: Key decisions made (e.g., 'Chose COUNT over AVG for error rate')

concerns.description: Potential issues or risks (e.g., 'Time range may be too short')

assumptions.description: Assumptions being made (e.g., 'Assuming status_code column exists')

questions.description: Clarifying questions for increased confidence (e.g., 'I would be more confident if I knew the expected error baseline')

tools.name: honeycomb_get_slo

Requires both the dataset slug and SLO ID. Returns the complete SLO configuration including the derived column used for the SLI calculation.

tools.name: honeycomb_create_slo
tools.description: Creates a new Service Level Objective (SLO) to track reliability targets, with automatic derived column creation if needed. IMPORTANT: Use this tool (not honeycomb_create_derived_column) when you want to create an SLO - it will create both the SLI derived column AND the SLO in one operation. Use this when defining reliability targets for services, such as 99.9% availability or p99 latency targets. Requires a dataset, SLO name, target (as percentage, per-million, or nines), time period in days, and an SLI definition. For the SLI, provide an alias and optionally an expression - if expression is provided, a new derived column is created inline; if only alias is provided, it uses an existing derived column. SLI EXPRESSION SYNTAX: Must return boolean (1/0 coerced). Use $ prefix for columns (case-sensitive). Example: LT($status_code, 500) or AND(LT($status_code, 500), LT($duration_ms, 1000)). See honeycomb_create_derived_column for full expression syntax (conditionals, comparisons, regex, etc.). You can also add burn alerts inline to notify when error budget depletes too quickly. Supports both single-dataset and multi-dataset SLOs.

BurnAlertInput.description:
Burn alert specification for inline creation with SLOs.

Two alert types:
- exhaustion_time: Alert when budget will be exhausted in N minutes
- budget_rate: Alert when budget is decreasing faster than threshold

exhaustion_minutes.description: Minutes until budget exhaustion (required for exhaustion_time)
exhaustion_minutes.title: Exhaustion Minutes

budget_rate_window_minutes.description: Window size in minutes (required for budget_rate)
budget_rate_window_minutes.title: Budget Rate Window Minutes

budget_rate_decrease_threshold_per_milli.description: Threshold in per-million units (required for budget_rate)
budget_rate_decrease_threshold_per_milli.title: Budget Rate Decrease Threshold Per Million

RecipientInput.description:
Recipient specification (shared across triggers, SLOs, burn alerts).

Either reference an existing recipient by ID, OR create a new one inline
by providing type and target.

Note: Only 'email' and 'webhook' types are testable without external integrations.
Other types ('slack', 'pagerduty', 'msteams') require service configuration.

target.description: Recipient target (email address, webhook URL, or integration ID)
target.title: Target

An SLI can either reference an existing column by alias, or create

tools.name: honeycomb_update_slo
tools.description: Updates an existing SLO's target percentage, time period, or SLI configuration. Use this to adjust reliability targets as service requirements change or to associate different derived columns. Requires the dataset slug, SLO ID, and the complete updated SLO configuration. Note: This replaces the entire SLO configuration. To update burn alerts separately, use burn alert tools instead.

SLI.description:
Service Level Indicator configuration.

The SLI references a derived column by alias. You can either:
1. Reference an existing derived column: just provide alias
2. Create a new derived column inline: provide alias + expression

When expression is provided, a new derived column will be created automatically
before the SLO is created.

alias.description: Alias for the derived column (existing or new)
alias.title: Alias

expression.description: If provided, creates a new derived column with this expression. If omitted, uses an existing derived column with the given alias.
expression.title: Expression

description.description: Description for the new derived column (only used when expression is provided)
description.title: Description

SLI.title: SLI
